page.title: 02EDUCATION,P.S.GOVERNORS
page.content: Following The Education Act,1980 schools were required to have new inatruments of government and in 1985 appoint new governing bodies. These include representatives appointed by the L.E.A.,Parish Council,parents,teaching and non-teaching staff. The duties of the governing body include the inspection and care of the buildings,consultation with the head on conduct and curriculum of the school and to act as a link between the LEA,parents,community and the school.Governors serve for four years but may be re-elected.The elect their own Chairperson.The LEA provide the services of a Clerk to the Governors. They are very supportive of all aspects of school life in its central role Within the community of Nicholforest.
